Basic Materials.description: Companies involved in the discovery, extraction, and processing of raw materials, including mining, forestry, and chemical production.

Communication Services.description: Companies that provide communication services using fixed-line networks or those that provide wireless access and services.

Consumer Cyclical.description: Companies that sell non-essential goods and services, which tend to be more sensitive to economic cycles.

Consumer Defensive.description: Companies that produce or sell essential products and services, such as food, beverages, and household items, which are less sensitive to economic cycles.

Energy.description: Companies involved in the production and distribution of energy, including fossil fuels and renewable energy sources.

Financial Services.description: Firms and institutions that provide financial services to commercial and retail customers, including banking, investment, and insurance.

Healthcare.description: Companies that provide medical services, manufacture medical equipment or drugs, and facilitate the provision of healthcare to patients.

Industrials.description: Companies that produce capital goods used in manufacturing and construction, including aerospace, defense, and machinery.

Real Estate.description: Companies involved in real estate development, operations, and services, including residential, commercial, and industrial properties.

Technology.description: Companies engaged in the research, development, and distribution of technologically based goods and services.

Utilities.description: Companies that provide basic amenities, such as water, sewage services, electricity, dams, and natural gas.
